column1: Salcedo is the capital city of the Hermanas Mirabal Province in the Dominican Republic. It is the birthplace of the Dominican heroines
column3: who died in the struggle against the dictator Rafael Trujillo.  A museum in the town commemorates three of sisters; it was tended to by the remaining sister
column6: 2014.The city is named after Francisco Antonio Salcedo who fought in the northwestern part of the country against the Haitian army during the Dominican-Haitian War after the Dominican independence from Haiti in 1844.

column1: Salcedo is located in the Cibao Valley
column2: south of the Cordillera Septentrional (in English
column3: "Northern mountain range"). It has a total area of 432.95 km². It has only one municipal district (a subdivision of a municipality): Jamao Afuera.

column1: In the place where is now the city of Salcedo there was a very small town with the name of Juana Núñez. It was made a Puesto cantonal (an old category that now is called Municipal District) in 1880 as part of the old La Vega province.With the creation of the Espaillat province in 1885
column2: Juana Núñez was made part of this new province. In 1891
column3: its name was changed from Juana Núñez to the present one

column1: Salcedo was made a municipality in 1905 and
column2: when the Salcedo Province (now Hermanas Mirabal Province) was created in 1952
column3: the city became the head municipality of the new province.

column1: Farming is the only economic activity in the municipality
column2: except for some very small industries; the main products are plantain

column1: The city became wide known outside of the Dominican Republic due to the Youtube video with an unusual request from the listener of a local radio station to play a song with the words "Essos son Reebok o son Nike" (meaning actually "Are they Reebok or Nike?").
